data.title: Allow units to keep veterancy & cloak status after transforming
data.body: When a unit transforms, it appears to lose its experience, as well as the ability to cloak (if it got it in a crate). It would be good if units would carry over all their traits after transformation.

data.title: vehicles: MCV enabled; msam use patriot; shroud
data.body:
MCV re-enabled. A construction yard build radius will be included in a later release to rein in basewalking.
Mobile SAM launcher's weapon is Patriot missile instead of HonestJohn.
Shroud reveal ranges on a few units adjusted

data.title: Adjustments for cnc
data.body:
ATWR HP reduced from 800 to 600
ATWR power consumptions inreased from 20 to 30
Increased sight range of towers to match their range.Â 
Silo moved over in build queue

data.title: Allow for playing your own music in mp3 and ogg format
data.body:
I think the music player should be able to read the music files in an ORA directory and play mp3 or ogg formats (as well as the original .aud's).

It would be nice to chuck more songs in there and have them play, without having to resort to an external player.

data.title: alphabetical/other map sorting
data.body:
It would be great to have sorting enabled on maps.
suggested sorting orders:
alphabetical
playernumber
map size

data.title: Bug #2590 Long server names...
data.body:
![Capture](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3826953/262246/a8f4b622-8d22-11e2-9555-45029b0b3bd2.PNG)
This is fixed. From the code now on it puts ... on the long server
names. (Maximum server name limit is 29 characters. In plus, I added a
tooltipwidget, this widget when a server name exceeds the limit, renders
itself on the screen.

data.title: add Valkirie to AUTHORS
data.body:
@Iran mentioned that the latest HackyAI files reminded him of code he already saw when BetaAI was introduced. It seems that @VrKomarov built upon https://github.com/Valkirie/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.RA/AI/HackyAI.cs and did a massive cleanup. Did not notice that at first sight. To comply with GNU GPL copyright notice requirements and for polite manners I hereby credit @Valkirie afterwards.

There are still some experimental features from that repository which could be merged back in without the hard-coding on the Red Alert actors, compiler warnings and unhandled exceptions. Discussion took place on http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=15984 but development was halted.

data.title: Weapon / Turret refactoring
data.body:
The massive pile of fail surrounding AttackBase and turrets is getting in the way of introducing a sane coordinate model for firing offsets. These changes get things closer to a sane base without introducing any gameplay changes.

AttackBase et. al. now supply only the targeting logic for the weapons and turrets, which are individually defined on each actor. Firing offsets are defined on each turret/weapon, and you can have any number of weapons distributed arbitrarily over any number of turrets.

I'm putting this up for review, but it shouldn't be merged until the following are resolved:
- WeaponMount is a dumb trait name, and should be changed (suggestions welcome). Weapon is unavailable because of a naming clash with GameRules.WeaponInfo.
- I've only modified the yaml for C&C and RA. D2k, the classic mods, and custom maps still need updating.

AttackBase.CanAttackGround should probably be moved to the weapon definition in weapons.yaml. Opinions for/against? This can be done in a followup patch.

data.title: Adds a Travis build check button to the repository frontpage
data.body: - Repository: [https://github.com/openra/openra](https://github.com/openra/openra) [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/OpenRA/OpenRA.png?branch=bleed)](https://travis-ci.org/OpenRA/OpenRA)

data.title: Fix Desync when Bots fire Super Weapons
data.body:
It was not going properly through the order generator and was only triggered on the host leading to a desync as evidenced at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2763#issuecomment-14889285 for RA and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2763#issuecomment-14826367 for CnC mod.

I also created an Airforce/Navy-only bot that is more suited for island maps for testing purposes.

data.title: Issue 2727 -> Show proper error message when connecting to a server of d...
data.body:
...ifferent version

It shows a proper message right now!

Note: I'm still trying ot understand the code, so I can make changes on
it.

data.title: Static AutoTarget nextScanTime to combat desyncs
data.body: This fix removes the random number generator, too and assumes actors won't scan for new targets all at once in non-scripted missions anyway because they start ticking upon placement into the world which is already fairly random. It seems that the auto-target desync problem persists in the last playtest releases https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2763#issuecomment-14826367.

data.title: I added myself to the Authors file
data.body: Thank you very much guys!

data.title: map editor - remove ore without also removing actor next to it
data.body:
In the map editor, when there is some ore behind an actor (say, a tree), I cannot delete the ore (by right-clicking) without also removing the actor. Having to manually put them back over and over is time-consuming. Could a way be made to delete ore without removing actors? One way I might suggest is allowing the user to select an area with and then press delete, to remove only ore (or whatever non-actor, non-tile things that may exist).

Another option might simply be making trees be removed by right-clicking on their bottom half instead of their top half. (That would be more intuitive, anyway).

data.title: Full Map Preview Rendering
data.body:
It was requested to offer full map preview
- [ ] as part of OpenRA.Utility for http://resource.openra.net by @ihptru 
- [ ] as part of OpenRA.Editor for mappers (wished by Harrison in the forums)

There is existing code:
- used by the content website, https://gist.github.com/Iran/5145824 (apparently just copy & paste from OpenRA.Editor surface rendering)
- for RA2/TS: https://github.com/zzattack/ccmaps-net/ (uses a refactored version of the OpenRA filesystem)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/136971-full-map-preview-rendering?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Hotfix: Addresses Desync Issues in AutoTarget Trait
data.body: Use integer math to calculate next auto-target scan-time to combat random desync problem because of rounding problems. This can lead to problems as evidenced at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2751#issuecomment-14704485.

data.title: DESYNC diff collection for playtest-20130311
data.body: This version has been enhanced with additional sync look-ups which should make syncreport.log more informative. It will dump some values to hunt them down in debug.log so you might want to check those, too. The debug.log is however harder to compare/interpret due to it's size and they get polluted by the live shellmap or previous games.

data.title: Diagonal scrolling area in viewport corners are too small
data.body:
I added two options, one is for EdgeScrollTreshold and the other one is
EdgeCornerScrollThreshold. You can modify these threshold as much as you
want.

Note: This code is related with the 2720 numbered issue.
URL:https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2720

data.title: Chrome yaml fixes
data.body: Don't crash with C&C cheats menu and add the new awesome lobby buttons to the Dune 2000 mod as well.

data.title: Csproj BuildEvents problem in both Linux and Windows
data.body:
I have found this error with the OpenRa.Mods.RA csproj: copy
"thirdparty/FuzzyLogicLibrary.dll" "$(SolutionDir)", this should be: cd
"$(SolutionDir)thirdparty/"
copy "FuzzyLogicLibrary.dll" "$(SolutionDir)" in two seperated codes,
this FuzzyLogicLibrary.dll copy error can be fixed in both Windows and
Linux environment
